Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[TFM Display] Add service that generates compatible frameworks." (#8869) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Description:
* A list of supported frameworks were added. This list is based on dotnet supported frameworks documentation.
* A service was created that returns a list of compatible frameworks.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3990

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Allow media.githubusercontent.com Images in README.md" (#8878) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

I have the following image in my README.md:

![Banner](https://media.githubusercontent.com/media/RehanSaeed/Serilog.Enrichers.Span/main/Images/Banner.png)

This uses the URL:

> https://media.githubusercontent.com/media/RehanSaeed/Serilog.Enrichers.Span/main/Images/Banner.png

This shows like this on NuGet:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2270364/141502737-0114d4d7-777b-461b-b85b-802f3a1b35a7.png)


### The Elevator Pitch

Please allow images from media.githubusercontent.com in README.md.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Allow Azure Pipelines Badge Images in README.md" (#8877) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

I use badge images from Azure Pipelines like this:

[![Serilog.Enrichers.Span package in serilog-exceptions feed in Azure Artifacts](https://feeds.dev.azure.com/serilog-exceptions/_apis/public/Packaging/Feeds/8479813c-da6b-4677-b40d-78df8725dc9c/Packages/3f8a2a7e-8124-4987-9c44-916dba83b9d6/Badge)](https://dev.azure.com/serilog-exceptions/Serilog.Enrichers.Span/_packaging?_a=package&feed=8479813c-da6b-4677-b40d-78df8725dc9c&package=3f8a2a7e-8124-4987-9c44-916dba83b9d6&preferRelease=true)

They currently show like this on NuGet:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2270364/141500441-233dfdef-4ab9-4db8-b4e0-c957e7d207ac.png)

Here is a link to the package:

https://www.nuget.org/packages/Serilog.Enrichers.Span/

### The Elevator Pitch

Azure Pipelines badges needs proper support.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Add Relative Image URL Support" (#8876) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

I would like to reuse my GitHub README.md in my NuGet package. I would like to use relative URL's for their simplicity but they are currently not supported.

### The Elevator Pitch

If you see that my NuGet package source repository is GitHub and contains:

```
<RepositoryUrl>https://github.com/RehanSaeed/Serilog.Enrichers.Span.git</RepositoryUrl>
```

Then automatically prefix the relative URL e.g. `/Images/Foo.png` with `https://github.com/RehanSaeed/Serilog.Enrichers.Span/blob/main`.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: NuGet SDK resolver should not throw if project path is NULL" (#11376) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

6.0

### Worked before?

Yes, 5.x

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

MSBuild will evaluate in-memory projects and ask SDK resolvers to resolve paths to SDKs.  In previous versions of MSBuild, a context is passed with a `null` value for the path to the project and the NuGet SDK resolver would throw an exception.  However, MSBuild would consider this non-fatal, log a warning, and try the next resolver.  In MSBuild 17.0, this logic changed to consider this scenario fatal and fail evaluation.

Related: https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/issues/7035

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
